definition: to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The injured kitten moaned the whole night.
sentences.chinese: 只受傷的小貓整夜地哀號。

sentences.english: I sit poised in my pew. No screaming or wailing.
sentences.chinese: 我鎮靜地坐在教堂的長椅上，沒有尖叫，沒有哀號。

sentences.english: And he started to race towards me; arms outstretched making a kind of wailing, screaming noise.
sentences.chinese: 他向我跑過來，伸展着胳膊，發出一種哀號的尖叫聲。

sentences.english: Why criest thou for thine affliction?
He howled like a wounded animal as blood spurted from the gash.
sentences.chinese: 血液從傷口中湧出，他像受傷的動物一樣哀號着。

sentences.english: With a wail the Queen cast herself down and began to weep and to beat her hands on the stones.
sentences.chinese: 女王哀號着撲倒在地，敲打着石地板痛哭起來。

definition: (of animals, the wind etc) to make a mournful sound/whine/moan/wail
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
in a split second
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
panic-stricken
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
morgue
to meet violent death/to get killed
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to sigh/to lament/to bewail
lingering fear
mournful (sound)
